Articles.Content:
Thank you!

This and Chatterer I consider my essential mods to play
I pushed a new version with an updated dll for the toolbar (v1.2)

I pushed a new version with an updated dll for the toolbar (v1.2)

Is this why the crew manifest is too cool to hang out with the other buttons and is doing its own thing? I have two toolbars now

Is this why the crew manifest is too cool to hang out with the other buttons and is doing its own thing? I have two toolbars now

Ya I have the exact same thing happening. Not a huge fan of the toolbar plugin >.<

Ah Sorry, with the bug pilling up in MJ I forgot to post that I uploaded the .23 version

I take back everything I ever said about French people...

(just kidding, I love the French).

Thanks for all your hard work!

Frostiken / Amazingteknique : check in the toolbar folder. You may have 2 version of the dll.

I need to work on a way to create the zip automatically, It seems I never do the same thing twice ...

I dunno, it doesnt seem to be an issue with this addon. I was also using the navy fish docking alignment that just recently started using that stupid taskbar. As soon as I removed it from my game Crew Manifest stopped trying to use two bars though. Not to mention I see that damn bar on my load screen every time I load. Its just a terribly constricting plugin (the toolbar). Did I mention that I hate it?? lol

I dunno, it doesnt seem to be an issue with this addon. I was also using the navy fish docking alignment that just recently started using that stupid taskbar. As soon as I removed it from my game Crew Manifest stopped trying to use two bars though. Not to mention I see that damn bar on my load screen every time I load. Its just a terribly constricting plugin (the toolbar). Did I mention that I hate it?? lol

Other than the loading screen annoyance - which I plan to fix -, what else is there that can be improved about the toolbar?

Is this why the crew manifest is too cool to hang out with the other buttons and is doing its own thing? I have two toolbars now

That sounds like the toolbar is not installed correctly, resulting in two instances running at the same time. I think I will add a check that will print an error message to the log. Or randomly explode your vessels

I dunno that is up to you what you want to improve. I just dont enjoy having all my addons in a linear or cube solution. I'd rather just place them where I like. At least be able to reorder them. The more addons adding into it the in my opinion uglier the interface gets. Thats just how I feel

I dunno that is up to you what you want to improve.

Well to be honest, personally I'm happy with the toolbar as it is now. So I'm really open to suggestions here

At least be able to reorder them.

That is a planned feature: https://github.com/blizzy78/ksp_toolbar/issues/2

But you know how it is - so little time, so much to do.

Also perhaps this should be continued in the Toolbar Plugin's players' thread to stop hijacking this thread

I dunno, it doesnt seem to be an issue with this addon. I was also using the navy fish docking alignment that just recently started using that stupid taskbar. As soon as I removed it from my game Crew Manifest stopped trying to use two bars though. Not to mention I see that damn bar on my load screen every time I load. Its just a terribly constricting plugin (the toolbar). Did I mention that I hate it?? lol

Haven't read all the posts, did anyone mention that to fix that Toolbar.dll needs to be deleted from navy fish mod folder?

Haven't read all the posts, did anyone mention that to fix that Toolbar.dll needs to be deleted from navy fish mod folder?

I don't know how you installed it, but - there needs to be exactly one folder GameData\000_Toolbar\, that ideally contains the latest version of the Toolbar Plugin. Any other copy inside a different folder shouldn't be there.

I don't know how you installed it, but - there needs to be exactly one folder GameData\000_Toolbar\, that ideally contains the latest version of the Toolbar Plugin. Any other copy inside a different folder shouldn't be there.

Generally, the same way as everybody does.

I'm talking about Toolbar.dll located in GameData\NavyFish\Plugins, removal of this file resolved double crew manifest button appearing on toolbar. Folder of toolbar mod itself is intact and was downloaded from toolbar mod's topic.

I had 2 toolbars too and it was crew manifest off on it's own in the second one:

Removing the extra Toolbar.dll from GameData\NavyFish got rid of it.
Edit : wrong thread

Is it required to have the toolbar mod for this? I dont have it and crew manifest doesnt show up at all in flight, or anywhere else. Ive never had this problem before but Im also trying to get it to work in KSP .23 for the first time.

Edited December 19, 2013 by Rassa Farlander
The toolbar mod is in Crew Manifest zip so you should have it.

I dont really want the tool bar mod though, I went back to the version I had with .22 and it seems to work in .23, can I expect any problems with that version? Sorry Im being difficult, I just dont really need the toolbar mod.

Is it required to have the toolbar mod for this? I dont have it and crew manifest doesnt show up at all in flight, or anywhere else. Ive never had this problem before but Im also trying to get it to work in KSP .23 for the first time.

I'm having the same issue. I've decided that I don't like the toolbar plugin, so I've removed it completely from my directory. However, since doing that, there is now no Crew Manifest button showing up anywhere. Is the toolbar a REQUIREMENT? The OP seems to indicate that it's optional, but if it's now required, that would suck because I REALLY don't like Toolbar.

Also, ever since updating to 0.23, as well as trying and then removing toolbar, I can't save anything in the VAB or SPH. Well I can save, the save button works, but at the top center of the screen where you type the name of the vehicle, and can also write a description, there is no black text area, and no text within it, not even 'Untitled Space Craft'. If I click on the area it 'pulls down' the gray text entry window, but I still can't type anything. The only reason I bring this up here is that I had this same problem a few weeks ago, BEFORE KSP v0.23, and it seemed to be caused by the version of the Toolbar plugin combined with CrewManifest that I tried then. At least, it stopped doing that when I removed Toolbar. But that was before. As I said, this time the problem persists even when I've removed Toolbar.

Could there be something in CrewManifest that's causing this? I mean, maybe there's something about the way it interacts with 0.23. Importantly, is anyone else having a similar problem?

I figured I'd start here, but if necessary I'll also post the problem

In the Toolbar thread and/or in Addon Support.

Later.

Some mod have added dual mode. I'll do that but you'll have to wait a bit since it''s not high priority

Neutrinovore I doubt it's the bar or CrewManifest. Most likely an other mod, you should check your outputlog in KSP_DATA

And yes, the old version should works fine.

Ok thanks for the speedy reply sarbian

Also is there a way to move the button in the config file? It covers up the science archive in the R&D center.

Thanks for the hard work with all the mods you do and maintain

Removing the extra Toolbar.dll from GameData\NavyFish got rid of it.

Good find, I didn't look into NavyFish's folders when I downloaded it.

I've decided that I don't like the toolbar plugin, ...

... because I REALLY don't like Toolbar.

I'd like to know what makes you say that. Note that I'm not trying to push the toolbar on you, your feelings are perfectly fine and using it is completely up to you. I'm just trying to figure out if there is anything I can do that can improve players' experience with the toolbar.

Perhaps you might want to post about that on the toolbar thread, though.
Jeez, why do people hate this toolbar so much? It's one of the most elegant solutions to an irritating problem.
